meanings.definition: Allowing light or other forms of energy to pass through.
meanings.sent1: The clear glass window was transmissive, letting sunlight fill the room.
meanings.sent2: The thin fabric was transmissive, allowing the soft glow of the lamp to shine through.
meanings.sent3: The transmissive screen seemed to magically make the images float in the air.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as transmissive as a beam of light, spreading joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The transmissive quality of the diamond made it sparkle brilliantly in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Capable of transmitting or conveying something.
meanings.sent1: The powerful antenna was transmissive, sending signals across long distances.
meanings.sent2: The telephone line was transmissive, carrying the important message to the recipient.
meanings.sent3: The transmissive nature of gossip made it spread like wildfire through the town.
meanings.sent4: His words were transmissive, resonating deeply with all who heard them.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's enthusiasm was transmissive, inspiring her students to learn with passion.
